page.title: 01GAZETEER
page.content: This area is approximately six miles from the Georgian city of Bath.It is a very rural area which includes the picturesque villages of Freshford,Limpley Stoke,Midford,Winsley and Monkton Combe.Because of its proximity to Bath and the fact that the motorway system is within ten miles,property in the area is rather expensive.This has resulted in many families of only one or two generations living in the area. A disused railway line runs through the district.This was the route for the Pines Express which went through to Bournemouth.In the 1950's the film 'The Titfield Thunderbolt' was filmed in Freshford.The Kennet and Avon canal,now being restored for pleasure craft,also passes through the area.
